description: Verify client accepts list of sentence-topic dictionaries with required keys
test_steps: Create list of dictionaries with 'sentence' and 'topic' keys
Call run() method with this input
Verify method accepts input without structure errors
verification: Method successfully accepts input structure and proceeds to validation/processing

description: Verify client rejects empty sentence field
test_steps: Create sentence-topic dict with empty string sentence: {'sentence': '', 'topic': 'valid topic'}
Call run() method with this input
Verify exception is raised
verification: Exception raised indicating empty sentence field detected

description: Verify client rejects empty topic field
test_steps: Create sentence-topic dict with empty string topic: {'sentence': 'valid sentence', 'topic': ''}
Call run() method with this input
Verify exception is raised
verification: Exception raised indicating empty topic field detected

description: Verify client accepts non-empty sentence and topic
test_steps: Create sentence-topic dict with non-empty values: {'sentence': 'Test sentence', 'topic': 'Test topic'}
Call run() method with this input
Verify no validation exception is raised
verification: Input passes validation and proceeds to transformation/processing

description: Verify output order matches input order for multiple pairs
test_steps: Create list of 3 distinct sentence-topic pairs in specific order
Call run() method
Verify output list has 3 scores
Verify score at index 0 corresponds to input at index 0 (by matching in response)
Verify score at index 1 corresponds to input at index 1
Verify score at index 2 corresponds to input at index 2
verification: Output order matches input order with one score per input pair

description: Verify batch processing handles multiple sentence-topic pairs
test_steps: Create list of 4 sentence-topic pairs
Call run() method
Verify all 4 pairs are processed in a single call
Verify output contains 4 scores
verification: Batch processing returns scores for all input pairs

description: Verify output is list of numerical scores matching input length
test_steps: Create list of N sentence-topic pairs (e.g., N=4)
Call run() method
Verify output is a list
Verify output length equals N
Verify each element is a number
verification: Output structure matches expected format: list of N numbers

description: Verify score at index i corresponds to input at index i
test_steps: Create list with distinctive sentence-topic pairs
Call run() method
For each index i, verify score[i] is associated with input[i]
Verify no shuffling or reordering occurred
verification: Each output score position matches its corresponding input position

description: Verify client provides run() method as public API
test_steps: Obtain Evidence Detection client instance
Verify run() method exists
Verify run() accepts sentence_topic_dicts parameter
Call run() with valid input
Verify run() returns list of scores
verification: run() method is accessible and functions as primary entry point

description: Verify client initializes with API key via factory
test_steps: Create DebaterApi instance with API key
Call get_evidence_detection_client() factory method
Verify client instance is returned
Verify client can make authenticated calls (run() succeeds)
verification: Client initializes with authentication and can make service calls

description: Verify EvidenceDetectionClient is distinct from ClaimDetectionClient
test_steps: Create DebaterApi instance
Get evidence_detection_client via factory
Get claim_detection_client via factory
Verify they are different class instances
Verify evidence client produces evidence scores
Verify claim client produces claim scores (different values for same input)
verification: Two distinct clients with different behaviors

description: Verify processing flows through validation before transformation
test_steps: Create input with one invalid pair (empty sentence) and one valid pair
Call run() method
Verify exception raised before any processing occurs
Verify no partial results returned
verification: Validation prevents transformation and processing when input is invalid

description: Verify transformation occurs after validation passes
test_steps: Create valid input with multiple sentence-topic pairs
Call run() method
Verify processing completes successfully
Verify results returned (indicating transformation and batch processing occurred)
verification: Valid input flows through complete pipeline to produce results

description: Verify validation checks all pairs before processing
test_steps: Create list with first pair valid, second pair invalid (empty topic)
Call run() method
Verify exception is raised
Verify no partial processing occurred (no results for first pair)
verification: Invalid pair in batch prevents processing of all pairs

description: Verify client handles single sentence-topic pair
test_steps: Create list with single sentence-topic dictionary
Call run() method
Verify single score returned
Verify result is still a list (not scalar)
verification: Single input produces single-element list output

test_steps: Create valid sentence-topic pairs
Call run() method
Verify each returned score is numeric (int or float)
Verify scores are not strings, booleans, or other types
verification: All output scores are numerical values

description: Verify exception includes information about which pair failed
test_steps: Create list with invalid pair at specific position
Call run() method
Catch exception
Verify exception message or data identifies the invalid pair
verification: Exception provides diagnostic information about validation failure

test_steps: Create valid sentence-topic pairs
Call run() method
Verify method blocks until results are available
Verify results are returned directly (not via callback or future)
Verify results are immediately available after method returns
verification: run() method operates synchronously and returns results directly
